oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Gas mask of Pvt. Joseph W. Knox
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Gas mask and case of Pvt. Joseph William Knox with anti-dimming stick. The case is marked "3" for size on the flap with owner's name hand written in purple indelible pencil. Various other numbers stamped on mask and inside of case. Knox served with Co. E, 11th Inf. Regt. in the Meuse-Argonne offensive. He was honorably discharged July 31, 1919. Knox married Ruth Gladhill in 1923 and worked as a brick mason and ran a dry cleaners in Dyer, Tennessee. [See also GWjack018-024, 500-516]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
